newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: RUGBY UNION-AUSTRALIA SURVIVE IRISH ONSLAUGHT.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-AUSTRALIA SURVIVE IRISH ONSLAUGHT.

text.p: Australia narrowly clung on to their unbeaten European tour record with a 22-12 win over a gallant Ireland at Lansdowne Road on Saturday.
The much-changed Irish side led 9-6 at halftime but were unable to hang on against the wind in the second half of a gripping encounter which saw the Wallabies stretched to the limit.

Five penalties from full-back Matthew Burke, who also converted a 78th minute try by David Knox, proved just enough to see Australia home in a near-repeat of their famous 1991 World Cup quarter-final on the same ground.
This time the Irish led 12-9 with 13 minutes left thanks to four penalties from fly-half Paul Burke, only for his namesake to spoil a potential upset with two long-range penalties in three minutes.
